result.execSummary:
The defendant Glen S. Stanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Shall be collected as a condition of supervision in 14CF122

records.addlTxt:
(14CF97 and 14CF122) Defendant Glen S. Stanford in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Mayer heard regarding Defendant entering pleas today.  State files Amended Information.  Atty. Mayer has no objection to amended information.  Atty. Mayer withdraws any motions to be heard today.  PAC .156%  Repeater enhancer in each case is dismissed.  Court reviews charges, penalties and rights.  Court reviews PQWOR.  Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1 Case No 14CF97 and No Contest to Counts 1 and 2 in Case 14CF122.  Court finds factual basis and pleas were made FV&K.  State heard.   Atty. Mayer heard.  Defendant does not wish to make a statement.  Court heard and accepts pleas and sentence is imposed:

14CF97:
$100 plus costs

14CF122:
Withheld 
2 years probation

Count 1 only:
DNA Sample
Costs
Shall receive 93 days credit should supervision be revoked

Count 2 only:
14 days DCJ w/H&T commencing forthwith
Alcohol Court 
$1820 (F+C)
27 mos. license revocation and IID 
VIP
AODA
Motion hearing on July 15, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

8:16.  (14cf97/122) Defendant, Glen S. Stanford, in court, in custody with attorney William A Mayer.   Attorney Kurt F. Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mayer enters NG pleas and ask that matter track with 14cf122; reading waived.  Court waives reading; enters NG pleas, will track matters, matter to be set for motion hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 03:30 pm.  No ORDER on ARRAIGNMENT filled out per JRS.
to dismiss/suppress illegal stop/detention/search and arrest
Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

(12:51) Defendant Glen S. Stanford in custody via video with attorney Greg E. Vollan (jail only); Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim 5/8/14 at 1:30pm in Br. 4 & RH 4/30/14 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets bond at $1,000.00 PA BOND with conditions: #5
